reviews.review: I was looking forward to this movie and have enjoyed the other Marvel movies but (just my opinion) this one stinks good action but so many missed moments and a terrible ending. This is the first one of the series I won't buy on DVD or other format
The best Avengers movie to date. Loved it!!

3.5/5 stars

Overall pretty good.  It is long, but doesn't feel as long as it is.   

There is a LOT going on -- tons of characters and lots of plot lines going on simultaneously in multiple places.  It actually felt a bit like some of the Star Wars movies in this way.  But it never felt confusing or like too much.

I really applaud them for having the courage to make some hard decisions in the movie (no spoilers here), but it definitely isn't the typical movie you'd expect.

One of the things that I hate about a lot of super hero movies (like maybe the Transformer movies) is that you have basically infinite power people combatting infinite power people and it just isn't interesting.   They did a good job at making the Avengers mortal and able to be defeated

I also really applaud how they were able to bring so many different franchises (Guardians of the Galaxy, Avengers, Black Panther, Thor, Spiderman, etc.) all together into a single coherent plot line.

Overall enjoyable.
7 out of 10... Hulk getting beat up early in the movie kind of ruined the movie for me...Plus some other stuff Infinity War didn't make sense...

Wow Marvel. This really sucked. The huge campaign against spoilers was not to protect some huge epic story line, but rather overused tropes and a lack of heart. And their attempts of making Thanos sympathetic were pathetic and endorse abusive behavior.  And btw Marvel, you don't kill off one of your most iconic and popular characters in the first ten minutes after two minutes of screen time.
i really liked the movie because everyone excpected the good guys to win
A must see for all marvel fans.

The plot was severely rushed: it went from Infinity Stone to creating a plan and then the plan failing and then losing the Infinity Stone to Thanos. There was only one piece of character development I could spot and that was from Doctor Strange but even then it couldn't be considered as character development as he obviously had some ulterior motives. And there was the plot holes. So many plot holes. Why not remove Thanos's arm? Why didn't Thanos just use the Power Stone to wipe out half the universe? And another thing about wiping out civilastions. Why did he destroy the Asgardians? Couldn't he have just done the thing that he did with Gamora's planet and save half of them? Honestly, I found it a complete mess but the acting and effects did make up for the plot in my opinion.
Great movie with action, great story line and the way of telling it. Every character played it's best.  The end was quite a disappoint but it was realistic. Best marvel movie to enjoy till date .

Infinity War is an epic story full of action, suspense, twists, darkness, and comedy. It is nothing short of what you would expect and goes so much further. The Russo Brothers have succeeded in putting together a film of such magnitude culminating 10 years of Marvel films. Fasten your seatbelt and be prepared to be entertained and shocked for this emotional roller coaster that hits the mark.
